required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tai Chi for Improving Functions of Frail Older Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Tai Chi on Physical and Cognitive Function Among Frail Older Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The goals of this study are to examine the physical function, cognitive function, and quality of life among frail elderly residing in the community

detailed_description.textblock:
This randomized clinical trial recruited 100 frail older adults, assigned to either the Tai Chi group or the wait-list control group. Tai Chi intervention will be provided to the Tai Chi group for 24 weeks and pretest and posttest measures will be conducted.
The primary outcome is the function variables (physical function of balance, flexibility, mobility; cognitive function of MOCA-K) The secondary outcome is quality of life measured by SF12.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: the frail older adults recruited from the community, randomly assigned to either the experimental group or the wait-list control group.
study_design_info.masking_description: the assessor will be blinded for the group assignment. trained research assistant will conduct the pretest and posttest measures, not involved in providing the intervention

primary_outcome.time_frame: changes from pretest to 24 week posttest scores
primary_outcome.description: balance was assessed using a one-leg-standing balance test (OLST)

primary_outcome.time_frame: changes from pretest to 24 week posttest scores
primary_outcome.description: flexibility was assessed by the standard sit-and-reach test (SSRT)

primary_outcome.time_frame: changes from pretest to 24 week posttest scores
primary_outcome.description: mobility was assessed by the Timed Up and Go test (TUG)

primary_outcome.time_frame: changes from pretest to 24 week posttest scores
primary_outcome.description: MOCA-K (Korean version of Montreal Cognitive Assessment) was used with the maximum score of 30. (more than 23 is normal and less than 13 is dementia, more cognitively impaired)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: changes from pretest to 24 week posttest scores
secondary_outcome.description: Short Form health survey 12 which consists of eight dimensions: general health, physical functioning, role physical, body pain, vitality, social functioning, role emotional, and mental health. two summary scores for the physical and mental components of health-related QoL are calculated by using the weighted means for the eight domains. Higher scores indicate better health-related QoL.

arm_group.description: Tai Chi group received 24 weeks of Tai Chi exercise program, twice a week, 60 min per session led by a trained Tai Chi instructor
control group received no intervention for 24 weeks, and will be provided the chance to participate in Tai Chi program if they choose.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- being frail (3 out of the following 5 criteria): feeling fatigued, difficulty climbing 10 stairs without help, difficulty walking 300m without help, more than 5 chronic illness, weight loss 5 % or more past 1-5 years
- living in the community
- able to participate in Tai Chi program twice a week
Exclusion Criteria:
- participated in any formal exercise program past 6 months
- not have transportation to come to the class

patient_data.ipd_description: unidentified data or study protocol can be shared at the completion of publication
